item.title: All Triptych Chest Locations & How To Open Them In Wuthering Waves
item.description:
Fabricatorium of the Deep is where players go in the Dreamcatchers in the Secret Garden Main Quest in Wuthering Waves . The area is split into five locations: Fallen Grave, Anima Cradle, Energy Hub, Sanctuary of Faith, and Lumen Tower. Throughout the area are slot machine-like chests called Triptych Chests. Here's how to open Triptych Chests and all the Triptych Chest locations in Wuthering Waves .

How To Open Triptych Chests In WuWa - Wuthering Waves

To open Triptych Chests in Wuthering Waves , players need to hit the Chest when three icons align . The idea is similar to how one can get a jackpot on a slot machine. However, since the symbols are moving at high speed, it's necessary to use the Orchestration Skill to slow them down.

Using the Crimson Baton or Wilting Reverberation Phrolova provides during and after the Main Quest unlocks the Orchestration Skill, allows Rovers to change the state of an object for some time. Pressing the Orchestration Skill near a Triptych Chest will slow down the rotating symbols, so Rovers can clearly see when the three icons align .

Each Triptych Chest offers players precious rewards such as Sacred Salt, upgrading materials, Union EXP, Shell Credit, and Astrite in Wuthering Waves .

Sacred Salt

Rovers can exchange the obtained Sacred Salt from Triptych Chests at Stewardâ€™s Supply Station in Sanctuary of Faith. Butler the Steward will trade Astrite, Supply Chests, Shell Credit, upgrading materials for the Sacred Salt.

All Triptych Chest Locations In WuWa - Wuthering Waves Fabricatorium Of The Deep

There are 14 Triptych Chests to locate in Fabricatorium of the Deep. The treasure chests are scattered around Anima Cradle, Energy Hub, and Sanctuary of Faith in Wuthering Waves .

Fabricatorium Of The Deep Triptych Chest Location #1

West of Anima Cradle, eastern Resonance Beacon players will find the first Triptych Chest in Fabricatorium of the Deep.

Fabricatorium Of The Deep Triptych Chest Location #2

Use the Flight Skill to fly to the southern slope or the rail to reach the second Triptych Chest in Anima Cradle.

Fabricatorium Of The Deep Triptych Chest Location #3

From the previous location in Wuthering Waves , use the southern rail to reach the Triptych Chest next to the Polyphone Orchestration puzzle.

Fabricatorium Of The Deep Triptych Chest Location #4

Go back to the previous slope, but this time use the western rail to reach another Triptych Chest in Anima Cradle.

Fabricatorium Of The Deep Triptych Chest Location #5

Teleport to Anima Cradle western Resonance beacon to find the fifth Treasure Chest in Fabricatorium of the Deep.

Fabricatorium Of The Deep Triptych Chest Location #6

Fast travel to Energy Hub eastern Resonance Beacon and collect the Triptych Chest beside it.

Fabricatorium Of The Deep Triptych Chest Location #7

Afterward, move northeast and use the Orchestration Skill to bypass the Power Controls with no harm, then do the following to solve the Pipeline Maintenance Puzzle in Wuthering Waves :

  • Interact with the Energy Pipe mechanic to send the energy through the Pipelines.
  • Press the Orchestration Skill to slow down the flow of energy.
  • Quickly move to the Breaker in front of it.
  • Wait until the energy passes the second mechanic.

A door will open, revealing more Power Controls. Use the Orchestration Skill to bypass them, then follow these steps to solve another Pipeline Maintenance Puzzle:

  • Start the energy flow by pressing the Energy Pipe mechanic.
  • Use the Orchestration Skill to slow the flow and the rotating obstacle.
  • Jump northeast.
  • Stand on the Break to ensure the energy flow through the second blockage.
  • Press the Orchestration Skill again to bypass two more obstacles and reach the opening door.

Behind it, Rovers will find the seventh Triptych Chest in Wuthering Waves .

Fabricatorium Of The Deep Triptych Chest Location #8

Move northwest, then turn right to locate another Triptych Chest in Energy Hub. Use the Orchestration Skill to reach and open the treasure without taking damage from the Power Controls.

Fabricatorium Of The Deep Triptych Chest Location #9

The ninth Triptych Chest is southwest of the Energy Hub Elevator. Rovers can reach it by following the northwestern passage of the previous location.

Fabricatorium Of The Deep Triptych Chest Location #10-11

Collect the previous chest and take the elevator down to the underground. There, players will find two more Triptych Chests in Wuthering Waves .

Fabricatorium Of The Deep Triptych Chest Location #12-13

Teleport to Energy Hub western Resonance Beacon, then use the Flight or Grapple Skill to reach the northeastern platform. Players will find two Triptych Chests there, one on the left edge and another on the opposite edge.

Fabricatorium Of The Deep Triptych Chest Location #14

The fourteenth and last Fabricatorium of the Deep Triptych Chest is next to Stewardâ€™s Supply Station in Sanctuary of Faith.

item.title: Wuchang: Fallen Feathers - Tempering, Explained
item.description:
There are a lot of mechanics to work with in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers, and if you want to deal more damage, Tempering your weapons is the way to go. However, this isn't just some simple weapon upgrade mechanic. There's more to Tempering than what its name suggests, and players will want to take full advantage of it if they want to survive.

This guide covers the basics of using the Tempering mechanic in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers , from how to unlock it to how to actually use it in battle.

What is Tempering in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers?

Tempering is a mechanic that lets players temporarily power up their weapons in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers . This is unlocked relatively early on in the game, right after players beat Dhutanga in Lightzen Temple.

In order to start Tempering weapons, you need to equip Needles via the Temper menu at any Shrine. Bone Needles grant your weapons major bonuses, such as adding elemental damage to your attacks. Meanwhile, Shadow Stone Needles give you smaller boosts to your stats.

You cannot equip Shadow Stone Needles without equipping a Bone Needle in your first Tempering acupoint slot.

How to Use Tempering in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers

In essence, Tempering is similar to using weapon greases in other Soulslike games â€” to use it, you need to equip the Temperance item in one of your quick slots . This has one charge by default, and it will recharge every time you dream at a Shrine. Using Temperance will cause Wuchang the slick her weapon against her cursed arm, imbuing it with whatever Needles you have equipped. The effect lasts for a relatively short duration, enough for you to get a few good combos in when fighting a boss.

Not all weapons benefit from Tempering, however. Weapons that already have elemental effects by default cannot be tempered , but anything that deals purely physical damage can. Elemental imbuement effects from Discipline or weapon skills do not override Tempering effects, so feel free to use them together for big damage.

You can unlock additional acupoints for Stone Needles by spending Red Mercury in the Impetus Repository.

Tempering is best used when fighting tough enemies like elites and bosses . Pay attention to what elements your target might be weak against â€” you'll eventually unlock Bone Needles for each elemental damage type and more, giving you a wide array of options to choose from.

item.title: Dead By Daylight: Best Builds for The Mastermind
item.description:
The Mastermind , aka Albert Wesker, is one of the more dangerous Killers that players can go up against in Dead By Daylight . Capable of traveling vast distances in the blink of an eye with his Virulent Bound, The Mastermind can launch Survivors great distances and infect them with his Uroboros tentacles, slowing them down to help close in on the kill. The Mastermind can become an even more formidable foe when combined with the right perks and playstyle.

This guide will walk players through some of the best builds they can run on The Mastermind in Dead By Daylight , taking non-teachable perks into account for newer players and showing off some of the best builds for the more experienced Killers.

Updated on July 24, 2025, by Mark Sammut: Nowadays, Albert Wesker is firmly established as a strong Killer in Dead by Daylight, and that is not going to change anytime soon. The following builds are still valid due to the character's last tweaks happening in patch 8.4.0; that said, if you are a relatively new player who wants to try out The Mastermind, they will first need to unlock them.

The Mastermind: Best Beginner Build (2025)

Players new to Dead By Daylight may not be entirely familiar with the Bloodweb system and the requirements for unlocking powerful perks. As many key perks and Killers must first be unlocked, either with Iridescent Shards or Auric Cells, new players will struggle with getting the more powerful perks without spending real money.

This build uses only perks that are available to The Mastermind and all other killers from the get-go, meaning players wonâ€™t have to worry about prestiging other Killers or waiting for the Shrine of Secrets to update to play with this build.

  • Terminus (The Mastermind) â€“ Once the final generator is complete, all injured Survivors receive the Broken status ailment until the exit gates have been open for 30 seconds.
  • Sloppy Butcher (General Perk) â€“ Basic attacks inflict the Mangled and Hemorrhage status ailments for 90 seconds, slowing down healing by 25% and regressing healing progress when left unfinished.
  • Bitter Murmur (General Perk) â€“ Each time a generator is completed, the auras of Survivors within 16 meters of that generator are revealed for 5 seconds. Once the last generator is complete, all Survivorsâ€™ auras are revealed for 10 seconds.
  • Hex: No One Escapes Death (General Perk) â€“ After the final generator is completed, all Survivors suffer from the Exposed status ailment and you gain a 4% Haste effect until the Hex Totem is cleansed.

The Mastermind: Best Build (2025)

Arguably, the best perks to use on The Mastermind are ones that make use of his quick speed, allowing him to put immense pressure on generators all across Dead By Daylight 's maps. The following build features some of the best teachable perks that unlock Albert Weskerâ€™s true potential.

  • Pop Goes The Weasel (The Clown) â€“ After hooking a survivor, kicking a generator regresses it by 20% of its current progress before applying the normal regression.
  • Nowhere to Hide (The Knight) â€“ Kicking a generator will reveal the aura of all Survivors within 24 meters for 5 seconds.
  • Scourge Hook: Pain Resonance (The Artist) â€“ The Killer starts with four tokens. For each different Survivor hooked on a white Scourge Hook, lose one token and explode the generator with the most progress, causing it to lose 25% of its progress.
  • Lethal Pursuer (The Nemesis) â€“ At the start of the trial, all Survivor's auras are revealed for 9 seconds. This perk also increases the duration of other auraâ€“reading abilities by an extra 2 seconds.

The Mastermind: Best Add-Ons

Albert Weskerâ€™s Virulent Bound is a highly customizable and easy-to-learn Killer power with his wide-ranging suite of add-ons. Here, players can find the very best add-ons for The Mastermind , sorted by their rarity on the Bloodweb.

Uroboros Tendril

A Common Add-On with a subtle effect, the Uroboros Tendril slightly increases your movement speed while charging Virulent Bound . This gives you a good means of staying close to Survivors as you ready your power.

Unicorn Medallion

Universally helpful, the Unicorn Medallion fundamentally changes how Weskerâ€™s power functions. By equalizing the distance of each Virulent Bound , you can better control your power around loops and missing Bounds becomes less costly.

Jewel Beetle

Besides a Bloodpoint bonus, this seemingly benign add-on has a quietly impactful capability. In decreasing mid-Bound grabbing distances , Wesker can more effectively throw Survivors around the map, throwing them into walls and landing them in dead zones, leaving them vulnerable to a quick follow-up attack.

Leather Gloves

The Leather Gloves decrease the recharge time on your power by 10% , making them a clear-cut choice for beginners and adepts alike, as well as those who arenâ€™t as proficient with hitting their Bounds.

Video Conference Device

Another uncomplicated add-on, the Video Conference Device increases the passive Infection gain rate by 30% . This makes Infected Survivors more quickly vulnerable to becoming slowed and instantly downed with a Bound.

Egg (Gold)

Often combined with the Unicorn Medallion or the Oroboros Tendril, the Egg (Gold) similarly makes Virulent Bound easier to deploy at loops by increasing the window between each Bound by 50% .

Helicopter Stick

Though many of The Mastermindâ€™s Very Rare Add-Ons remain fairly niche in their application, the Helicopter Stick can work well in tandem with the Bullhorn to maintain Infection and put pressure on Survivors who use First Aid Sprays by revealing their aura for 8 seconds .

Iridescent Uroboros Vial

While both Ultra Rare Virulent Bound Add-Ons offer their own unique ways of approaching The Mastermind, the Iridescent Uroboros Vial takes the crown as the strongest. Infecting everyone at the start of the trial â€“ as well as making those recently Infected Exposed â€“ this add-on works wonders with The Nemesis' Lethal Pursuer and the Video Conference Device Add-On to quickly secure a kill and reduce the amount of First Aid Sprays left on the map.

How To Unlock The Mastermind In Dead By Daylight?

Added to Dead by Daylight in August 2022, Albert Wesker is well-established as a Killer, and he is generally regarded as one of the more fun characters in the game. Also, his Resident Evil background has (naturally) helped propel his popularity, as the two franchises must have quite a bit of player crossover.

If you are playing around with The Mastermind builds , you already own Wesker; however, if you want to switch to a different main and are considering this Killer as an option, you will first have to add him to your collection. As with all licensed characters, The Mastermind must be purchased with cash and cannot be picked up by just playing the game and collecting Iridescent Shards. Albert Wesker costs 500 Auric Cells , or $4.99. That is the standard price for licensed DLC characters, but Dead by Daylight is no stranger to sales. Consequently, if you are not in a rush to obtain this character, it might be worth waiting for a discount. They happen.

Alternatively, you can purchase the "Chapter 25: Resident Evil: Project W" package, which either costs $11.99 or 1500 Auric Cells. Now, this DLC chapter is relatively expensive compared to some others, but that is because it also includes two Survivors: Ada Wong and Rebecca Chambers. The Green Vial Charm is also part of the DLC. Purchasing all three characters individually is more expensive than picking up Chapter 25, but that is only true if you intend to use Wong and Chambers.

item.title: Wuchang Fallen Feathers: All Worship's Rise Boss Locations
item.description:
When it comes to the bosses in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers , the game does an excellent job of delivering powerful and challenging fights that require players to not only understand each move but also adjust their builds accordingly. There are six bosses in Worship's Rise , all of whom reward the player with a trophy/achievement. Out of these six, five are tied to the main story and must be defeated to access the second main area. This guide offers information on the locations of all Worship's Rise bosses in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers .

The guide below contains major boss spoilers related to their appearance.

All Worship's Rise Boss Locations in Wuchang: Fallen Feathers

Master Raider - Man-eating Dhutanga

You can find the first boss in the game fairly early on. From the Reverant Temple Shrine , head down the stairs and turn right, going past the two enemies standing next to the gate. Head right from the gate and follow the path , staying on the right side. As you go up, you will reach a scaffolding area and must make your way all the way to the top.

At the top, you will find the second Shrine of the region, Buddha Cliffs. After resting at the Shrine, head down the ladder and enter the cave. It is here that you will find the first mini-boss, Tang Palace Maid. Defeat her and take the path above the stairs, turning right as soon as you exit the cave. Go down the slope and continue straight until you reach a split. The path on the right leads to a few enemies alongside the Entwined Legend Pendant , while the path on the left is the one you need to take for the boss.

Head straight to find the third Shrine, Lightzen Temple . This is the last Shrine before the first boss, so be sure to get your gear in check and level up before you proceed . From the Shrine, go up the stairs and ignore the two enemies in the courtyard. Keep moving forward toward the building ahead, and there should be a gate that you can open, which starts the boss fight with Master Raider â€“ Man-eating Dhutanga .

Feathered Priest - Lu Bingzhang

After the first boss fight, head back to the Shrine and take the opposite path to unlock the door using the Lightzen Key . Turn right and follow the linear path leading toward Narrow Stretch. You will come across a set of stairs on your left and a path on the right that leads to the Panda merchant , who sells items in exchange for Bamboo Shoots .

Head up the stairs on the left path and keep moving left until you encounter the empowered armored enemy. Defeating this enemy drops the Ming Armor , which is quite useful early in the game, so taking him out can be rewarding. However, if youâ€™re low on health, itâ€™s better to ignore him, as just ahead is the Shu Sanctum , where youâ€™ll find your next Shrine along with multiple NPCs, marking this as an Important Location.

From the Shrine, head up the stairs and continue up another staircase that leads to the top floor. Once there, youâ€™ll find a door that leads to the Feathered Priest â€“ Lu Bingzhang boss room.

Make sure to equip the Purple Camellia in your Hotbar so you can use it during the fight, as the boss has several attacks that cause Corruption build-up.

Gluttonous Monstrosity - Lu Hongliu

From the Shu Sanctum Shrine, head back down the stairs to where you fought the empowered enemy that drops the Ming Armor set, then go right. Even though it looks like thereâ€™s a gap, you can easily cross to the other side . Go down the steps and keep heading straight. Soon youâ€™ll reach a point where the path splits into three directionsâ€” take the one on the right, with stairs going up and two dogs in sight . Head up, go through the building, and turn right while avoiding the boulder that comes rolling down.

After dealing with the enemy who pushed the boulder, look to your right to find a way up to the rooftop where thereâ€™s a ladder . Climb up, move past the enemies, and reach the next ladder on the other side. After going down, youâ€™ll face the Fire Dancer; defeat them, then take either side path to head up and spot a blood trail leading up the stairs .

Before going up and triggering the boss fight, look just to the right of the stairs to find a path that leads to a tree . Knock it down to create a shortcut to the first floor of Shu Sanctum, allowing you to rest at the Shrine, and acquire skills before taking on Gluttonous Monstrosity â€“ Lu Hongliu .

Blightweaver - Giant Centipede

From the Shu Sanctum Shrine, interact with the mechanism in front of you, which requires the Shu Sanctum Key . This opens a path leading underground to the Mercury Workshop . Follow the path down and go through the corruption passage to find a Shrine on the right. Head down the fleshy path next to the Shrine and take the route where the two rifle enemies are firing at you . Go down the wooden planks, head right, then left to find a ladder going up.

Drop into the small room with the empowered enemy and deal with him before heading out. Keep in mind that there are enemies on both sides as you exit the room who will try to grab you, so be cautious while dealing with them using your weapon . There will be paths on either side, but you can ignore them and go down the ladder to access the elevator that goes up to the Shrine. From the elevator, head straight across and turn right to find two enemies near the fleshy path . Turn left and continue all the way down until you find a ladder going down.

Deal with the enemy next to the ladder and go across to find another ladder that leads you to the second elevator. Head right and keep going straight until you spot a path on the left leading to an open chest with an item . Go to either side to reach the stone path, which has multiple items, but be wary of enemies that will appear in front of you.

Head right and then left, going across the wooden walkway, which leads to the Bandit Cave and your next Shrine. From this Shrine, turn around and take the right path all the way down to the boss arena for Blightweaver â€“ Giant Centipede .

Reborn Treant - Soulwood

After defeating the boss, look to the left to find an exit and take the elevator up inside the Tower of Sacrifice to reach a door you must open. Soon after, youâ€™ll spot He Youzai ahead, who mentions his lost package . Return it to receive the Pirate Armor set . Head right to find the only Shrine in Doomwillow Beach. From here, you can take three different paths, excluding the one you arrived from. Go up the far-left path filled with skeletons and grotesque four-legged creatures.

Follow it until you reach the blood river, then head left and continue straight until you see a slope next to some fire . Go up and immediately turn left, ignoring the tree, and head to the ladder in the distance. Climb up and t urn right to find a Corpse Tree you can attack to reach an NPC next to another tree.

Thereâ€™s a path here that leads down; turning left at the end leads to a large chest containing a Forgotten Remembrance.

Now take the right path and follow it all the way down. Youâ€™ll reach the Corpse Pits , where you can fight one of the easiest bosses in the game, Reborn Treant â€“ Soulwood .

Commander - Honglan

Once the boss is defeated, interact with the Shrine and go up the nearby path to reach Palace Pass . Climb the staircase and turn left to cross the wooden bridge. Follow the linear path , climb the ladder, and continue forward to reach the entrance of Tang Emperor Palace . Avoid the Tripwire mine near the entrance, head inside, go up the stairs, and turn left at the set of bridges . Head toward the house, then turn right to find a path going up the temple and a ladder leading down to a shielded enemy.

Open the large red door ahead to unlock access to the Shu Sanctum Shrine . Go left, up the stairs, and take the wooden ramp toward the torch-wielding enemy surrounded by Tripwire mines . Continue on the straight path to face a moderately tough enemy near the stairs that descend to the first Mysterious Gate.

Head left of the gate and continue straight until you reach the temple with an open door. Inside, you can fight the Tang Palace Maid again and loot a large chest containing Lost Remains . After exiting, go straight and turn left to find a ladder. Take the right path to reach the Palace Hill Shrine . Youâ€™ve passed the boss arena for this area, but it wonâ€™t trigger until you find the Buddha Statue . Go down from the Shrine and use the statue to the left, near the NPC in white.

This lowers the water level in the courtyard. Climb down the ladder, turn right, and head to the area opposite the temple where you fought the Tang Palace Maid. Youâ€™ll find a drop-down spot that leads to the boss fight: Commander â€“ Honglan .

item.title: Umamusume Pretty Derby - Matikanefukukitaru Build and Stats Guide
item.description:
With so many horse girls to choose from in Umamusume: Pretty Derby , it can be hard to pick just one to focus on for career mode. Matikanefukukitaru is one of the most unique horses in Umamusume , but her stat spread and skill line up make her one of the easiest girls to train.

Matikanefukukitaru is a Late Surger that specializes in Medium and Long races on Turf tracks, which separates her from the sea of Pace Chasers and Front Runners currently on the Umamusume roster. There are other horses that share the same archetype as her, but her stat growth bonuses and interesting skills give her a unique playstyle. Even if you can't pronounce her name, this Matikanefukukitaru build will help you win more races in career mode and dominate PVP in Team Trials.

Best Stats for Matikanefukukitaru

Matikanefukukitaru is primarily a Late Surger and she runs the longest distances in the game, so Speed and Stamina are of equal importance. You should ideally have 900-1000 of each to comfortably clear her hardest career mode races, and getting Speed above 1000 is a good idea for Team Trials.

Since she has to pass every other runner in the back half of the race, Power is her next most important stat. Aim for 700-800 Power to ensure that Matikanefukukitaru can navigate through the crowd and take corners without losing too much energy. You can get away with a little bit lower if you compensate with some Wit and skills, but you still shouldn't go anywhere below 700 Power with Matikanefukukitaru.

Wit and Guts are her least important stats, but you should still invest at least a little bit of training time for Wit since skills are incredibly important for Late Surgers. 400 Wit is a safe threshold, but you can go even higher depending on your Support Card deck and Sparks if you want to go with a skill-heavy build for Matikanefukukitaru. You can get away with 300-350 Guts , though.

Matikanefukukitaru has a 20% growth rate bonus for Stamina and a 10% growth rate bonus for Power , so you should have a super easy time training those stats. Paired with some strong Support Cards and friendship training, Matikanefukukitaru's Stamina requirements can be taken care of much faster than other racers, and you won't have to waste as many days on Power training, either.

Best Support Cards for Matikanefukukitaru

The best Support Card deck for Matikanefukukitaru includes three Speed cards, two Stamina cards, and a Wit/Power card in the last slot. You can swap things around a bit depending on which SSR Support Cards you have in your collection, but the general structure should still remain the same.

These are some of the strongest Support Cards you can use with Matikanefukukitaru in Umamusume: Pretty Derby .

  • Kitasan Black (Speed)
  • Sweep Tosho (Speed)
  • Nishino Flower (Speed)
  • Tokai Teio (Speed)
  • Eishin Flash (Speed)
  • Super Creek (Stamina)
  • Satono Diamond (Stamina)
  • Mayano Top Gun (Stamina)
  • Vodka (Power)
  • Agnes Digital (Power)
  • Matikanetannhauser (Guts)
  • Grass Wonder (Guts)
  • Fine Motion (Wit)
  • Nice Nature (Wit)
  • Agnes Tachyon (Wit)
  • Marvelous Sunday (Wit)
  • Tazuna Hayakawa (Pal)

As a Late Surger (or a Pace Chaser if you want to go that route) with long races to run, Matikanefukukitaru needs a lot of help training Speed and Stamina . Thankfully, there are plenty of SSR and SR options to choose from for those stats. Kitasan Black and Tokai Teio are two excellent SSR Speed options for Matikanefukukitaru, and Super Creek and Satono Diamond are perfect Stamina fits. Sweep Tosho a nd Mayano Top Gun are great SR replacements for each stat as well, especially if you've uncapped them with duplicates.

Vodka and Fine Motion are the best choices for Power and Wit, respectively, but you can get away with other Support Cards like Agnes Digital or Agnes Tachyon if you need SR options. You can also use Tazuna Hayakawa as a Pal Support Card to help with energy, so you can spend more time training and less time resting.

Best Skills for Matikanefukukitaru

These are the best skills for Matikanefukukitaru in Umamusume: Pretty Derby , whether they come from unlocks or legacy inheritance.

  • Luck Be with Me!
  • A Small Breather
  • Smoke Screen
  • Sharp Gaze
  • Trick (Rear)
  • Swinging Maestro
  • Deep Breaths
  • Extra Tank
  • Passing Pro
  • Iron Will
  • Relax
  • Professor of Curvature
  • Beeline Burst
  • Ramp Up
  • It's On!
  • Outer Swell
  • Stamina Siphon
  • Stamina Eater
  • Shooting Star
  • Sky-High Teio Step
  • Anchors Aweigh!
  • Position Pilfer
  • Late Surger Straightaways/Corners

These skills enhance Matikanefukukitaru's abilities as a Late Surger, recovering her energy so she can be prepared for the final stretch and boosting her speed so she can actually pass everyone else when it matters. She also works well with a few debuff skills that inhibit other runners so she has an easier time taking the lead. With these skills, Matikanefukukitaru can carry you all the way to the URA Finale in career mode and help you win more PVP races in Team Trials.
